Bring all of your nickles and dimes because if you want basics like, oh I don't know, CHEESE, on your taco, you'll need them. That's right, it's 60 cents for cheese, a dollar for guacamole, and 50 cents if you want chips and salsa with your order.

But more than that, the food just doesn't match the gorgeous, rustic decor. I appreciate that it is high-quality and am willing to pay more for that ($9.62 for two crispy tacos with cheese), but I am not willing to pay more for utterly flavorless food and bad service. (I ordered one regular chicken taco and one spicy chicken taco; I was completely unable to tell the difference between the two since neither had any taste at all.)

Skip the prickly people and prices at the Iron Cactus and get a sandwich or crepe at The Creamery (right next door and owned by the same people, I'm pretty sure) instead.
author: daisy b.

description:
Free associating words with my experience here:  Stressful... overpriced... bland... messy... sh*t show!

Also, I don't know who said to themselves, "You know what this area needs?  ANOTHER Mexican joint!  I mean, there's only like, 4 others in a 5-block radius!  We don't need culinary prowess, we've got ATMOSPHERE!  Surely this is what will make people seeking burritos choose us!"

I wish I had thought to take a photo of my bf's "tortilla soup" for failblog... I observed this process and presentation--- are you ready?  Ok:  Literally, they scooped some chicken and... liquid (?) from what I am almost CERTAIN is the container of mild chicken used for burritos and put it in a bowl.  Then, in they placed some avocado chunks, some cojita cheese, and some cold roasted corn into 3 individual plastic cups, and teetered them on the edge of the bowl.  Voila!  Tortilla soup!  That will be $6.50, please.  
*Notice that nowhere did I make mention of anything resembling, oh, i don't know... a tortilla?

That was probably the most amusing offense, but rest assured: nothing tasted like anything, the open area where food is assembled/plated was a disaster (wiping knives on filthy aprons, etc), they place their soft tacos on to paper sheets that stick to the tortilla (thus making it impossible to pick up the taco lest you rip the bottom off), and the salsa is... I don't even know what the hell is in it, let alone what it's supposed to taste like.

Run awaaaaaaaaaay!
author: Laura F.

description:
I could find better tasting Mexican food in the frozen isle at the local grocery store. Its conveniently located at the corner of 4th and Townsend but if you have any taste for Mexican food you are going to be thoroughly disappointed. 

My chicken burrito was $6.95 + Tax and some tip. Press your fingers together and you will get a size of the diameter - yes it was small and poorly rolled (poor quality control). The chicken was flavorless albeit not dried out, rice/beans - meh, flour tortilla was ordinary, sour cream was added without my consent or asking. Add those together and you get a terrible burrito. Luke warm, mushy, untasty and totally dissatisfying. 

The workers were poorly trained as evident by the poor construction of the burrito and lack of communication. It saddens me how I could go on rambling about how terrible this place is but I truly hope they can shape up and serve some quality food as its conveniently next door to my work.

Best of luck to the management and making things better.
author: Francois M.

description:
My nachos tasted like the kind I used to make as a child.  An 8 year old child that just learned how to use the microwave. 
DELISH!
author: Jen H.

description:
First Impressions can unfortunately be so Damning. 

The place looks nice, the food looks ordinary (taste test pending) I just had to vent a bit before I sit down to eat my Spicy Chicken Burrito--to go.

I live in the neighborhood and was delighted when I learned that  a new taqueria was opening so close to home.  I wanted to send a visual to my partner who is away on business. We had both been looking forward to giving the place a try. As I was making an MMS to send on my phone, a woman behind the counter said, "Sir, your not allowed to video-tape in here." I asked her why, to which she replied with some tone, and some mild swivel-head,"because its the rules!" 

So, I have to wonder, why in the hell can't you make a video in a taqeiria?! Some fear of liability? Is the place not built to code? Are the workers secretly famous and avoiding the paparazzi? It was a real turn off. If the burrito place is going to operate as a micro-police-state they should post the rules and regulations to which she referred. 

As it stands now, unless the food is absolutely delicious, I'll take a pass on this joint here on out.
author: Brian D.

description:
Anyone who has allotted this place more than two stars was either drunk while eating or has some how avoided the myriad of other Mexican dining options in SF. 

Want a cheap Taco/burrito?   -   Go to the Mission, almost any place on Mission will blow this place out of the water. 

Want actual Mexican food with actual service?   -  Go to Nopalito, for what you get it's a hell of a lot better value than Iron Cactus and is some of the best food in the City. 

Want something better than Iron Cactus?   -  Well go to freaking Chili's or Chipotle, because even they make the Iron Cactus look like crap.

With only 30 minutes before our show at AT&T Park Abby Z. and I were looking for a quick bite, enter Iron Cactus: Cute, warm, decently busy for a Wednesday night. Running out on time we went in and ordered. The place is set up like Chipotle you order and pay at the counter and than go sit down. I wouldn't call this place cheap by a long shot; Abby's tacos were like $3.79 each, and my salad was $8.50. I got a four dollar beer and we munched on some chips, things were looking good, than appears the food:

My $8.50 chicken salad was a lame handful of romaine in a bowl adorned with a few red onion rings, some dry-ass chicken, and a scattering of corn and beans. I 'm not a huge eater, but when you pay $8.50 at an order-at-the-counter Mexican place you expect an entree, not an appetizer, or  at the very least you expect your small portion to be excellent and not totally tasteless. 

The tacos were cafeteria grade, complete with those junky pre-formed crispy taco shells you can buy at Safeway (yuk!). Where this place gets off serving this food in SF, home to some of the best Mexican cooking America, or why it appeared people living in the area were dining here remains a mystery to me. Let it be a mystery to you too and don't set foot in the Iron Cactus.
author: Alex D.

description:
This place has the worst tacos EVER!

I asked for the spicey chicken, and it had no flavor at all.  The chicken was dry and chewy. Yet it was hanging out in a sauce. I asked for refried beans and got pinto beans.  I asked for spicey salsa, and got the most mild salsa on the planet.  The tortilla stuck to the paper on the plate, I'm not sure why there needs to be paper between food and the plate.

I ended up eating the tacos with a fork, as I couldn't pick up the taco, with my hand, and eat is normally.

Unless you are looking to drink beer here the beverage selection is lacking.
author: skot l.

description:
Five stars for bringing a mission burrito out of the mission. The reviews here make me lose a lot of faith in Yelp: I've eaten here four times since their opening and while the service and ordering need some work, the food is always consistently delicious (not surprising given that the chef came from Pancho Villa).

Without getting into the religious debate around mission burritos, this is certainly in the range of others, and after a few months I imagine they will be a solid contender.

Name another place you can get a burrito of this quality in SOMA, especially a block from caltrain. Chavos? Not even close. Tres Agaves? Nope. Luna Taqueria? El Norteno Truck? Maybe if they're open. All I know is that Iron Cactus is a regular part of my eating schedule.
author: Cameron M.

description:
I'm flummoxed by the many negative reviews, because I thought Iron Cactus was quite good. It caught my eye as I was walking home from work, and I decided to stop in and get a taco.

I ordered a soft taco with corn tortilla, spicy chicken, and black beans. It cost $3.50, but I soon realized why. It was the most delicious and overstuffed taco I've ever had. Two thin tortillas tried to support a mound of chicken, beans, rice, sour cream, salsa, and cilantro, but couldn't quite do it. 

A word of warning: when they say spicy, they mean it. I eat spicy food all the time, and I figured I could handle spicy chicken and spicy salsa.  My bravado almost got the best of me. The chicken itself was a little dry, but the taco as a whole was delicious and flavorful.

Can't wait to return!
author: David Z.

description:
bleh. not good mexican food! Don't be fooled by the nice, warehousey decor. 

Tacos are weak and inauthentic. You may as well take the effort to go to the Mission instead for a real taco. 

I ordered a posole soup, and some soft tacos for snack. The soup was lukewarm, had no flavor. The only saving grace was the fresh avocado they serve it with. 

Tacos had no flavor or vegetables either. Super disappointing. Stay away or go make your own tacos.
author: Joyce T.

description:
I love this place!

I SERIOUSLY do not understand what all the haters on here are talking about. I've been here many times since first discovering it down the street from my house in December, and I have NEVER been disappointed. I mean, really--I know what good food is, and I just don't understand how so many people could be so far off about this place.

There is a dearth of Mexican food in my neighborhood, so I jumped at the chance to go here when I found it. The staff is friendly and attentive, and the food has always been great (I love the fish tacos, and my husband had great things to report on the shrimp quesadilla). The interior decor is really cool, and I love how it is the only restaurant in the neighborhood where families with little kids seem to congregate. It makes the neighborhood seem like more of a COMMUNITY, which, down in Mission Bay, is something we've been waiting for a long time.

I encourage you to try it out and have an open mind. I mean, really. If I complained half as much as the people who usually frequent Yelp do, I'd be a pretty miserable person--so please, take the negative reviews with a huge grain of salt.
author: Amber G.

description:
I really really like Iron Cactus.  I think the food and sauces are delicious.  My favorite are the enchiladas, although the spicy shrimp salad is pretty fantastic.  They use quality, fresh ingredients, focus on healthier dishes and are not afraid to make things spicy!

There is plenty of seating and the interior is cute.  I wish they had made a little more standing room for those waiting for take-out, though.  Today, I felt like I was in the way while they prepared my lunch.

It's hard to make Mexican food in San Francisco that is differentiated from all the other Mexican food in this town.  I can think of six places to get basically the same burrito within a two block radius of this location.  In the 4 1/2 years I've worked in the neighborhood, I've typically just gone to whatever was closest.  However, I'm willing to walk to Iron Cactus. 

I really hope to see them make it!
author: Amy A.

description:
We love the Iron Cactus. 

My husband, 2 y.o. son and I come in about once a week - my son would live off of their rice and black beans if we allowed him to! We're always greeted with a smile. 

Food is great - everything is perfectly seasoned and hits the spot when you're craving Mexican food. I switch back and forth between the burrito bowl and the enchilada plate - you can't go wrong either way!

We recently had our son's birthday party on their patio and it couldn't have been more perfect. We took suggestions on the food and layout from Ivor, the owner, and he hit it out of the ball park going above and beyond our expectations. There was plenty of yummy food, the weather was perfect, and the space was ideal for little kids - the back door to the patio was closed, so the kids had a safe, contained play space. The adults had plenty of sangria and beer, and no one left hungry! Sal, our host/server, worked hard to ensure we had everything we needed. It was a fantastic day.

Do consider the Iron Cactus for your next party or get-together. It really is a gem right here in SOMA!
author: Sarah R.

description:
Muy expsensivo.  I went in when it was totally empty at 3 for a late lunch snack. I decided to give the nachos a try because it was happy hour and they were only $2.  Well they took forever and I couldn't believe it but they microwaved them.  I can do that at home, thank you very much.  It was mediocre. 

And, I looked at the menu to come back for other stuff.  Almost $10 for a burrito?  Really? Seriously??  No es bueno.

Doubt I'll be back.  Instead will be going to Mexico au Parc in South Park which is AWESOME and a good value for your money.

Adios, Iron Cactus...
author: OakMama D.

description:
I'm surprised with the low ratings of this place.  I actually thought it was good.  I've lived in the SOMA area for a little more than a year now and am always in search of a Mexican joint in the area.  I'm very excited that we now have this place to stop by for some Mexican eats.

We came here on a rainy night while the power was out due to the thunderstorms in the Bay Area this week.  We checked it out to see if it was open and although it was dimly lit due to the power outage, we saw a good number of patrons having their dinner and service staff at the counter.  It was so on!  We were encouraged by the fact that they were still open and were able to serve hot food.

I ordered the burrito with carne asada, my boyfriend ordered the burrito with chili verde and we shared a small order of guacamole and tortilla chips!  I really enjoyed my burrito.  It wasn't monstrously huge, but still filling.  I killed it because I was starving from a light lunch!  The guacamole was okay...I think I like Chipotle's guac better.  But, the guac here was satisfactory, along with the mild and hot fresh salsa.

I can't say this is the best Mexican food I've ever had.  But, honestly, it satisfied my hunger and craving for some good Mexican food.  Plus, it's cheap.  It's also a couple blocks from where I live!  They serve beer and wine and have their own home made sangria, which I'd like to try next time.

The place isn't huge, but not bad if you want to stop by for a quick meal.  The vibe is pretty chill and the service staff was really friendly.

We'll be back!!!  'Just noticed they have a happy hour menu, and I definitely want to check it out!
author: Christine E.

description:
$5 Sangria and mimosas. Patio for sunny weekend days. FREE tan. So what if the patio side coffee shop area reminds me a bit of a repurposed Starbucks? The patio is huge, is conveniently located 2 blocks from my house, and is my favorite place to drink $5 mimosas after filling up on $3 mimosas at Brickhouse on sunny weekend days. 

Service is minimal (think coffee shop line) but very friendly and drinks are tasty and generous. I may just be a sucker for sunshine and booze, but I think Iron Cactus is great.
author: Autumn K.

description:
Really tasteless burritos. I got the spicy chicken burrito with spicy salsa and it really was not at all spicy. The chicken was also pretty flavorless and the burritos -- which sell for $6.95 -- don't even include cheese, lettuce or guacamole. You're essentially paying "super" burrito prices for a really bland, boring burrito.

The only reason that it gets 2 stars instead of 1 is the atmosphere and the chips. It was nice to sit there and eat. It's really big and open and once you order you get a number and wait for someone to bring you your food. The chips are also pretty tasty and crispy as far as your average taqueria chips go.

I probably won't go back there unless someone else offers to pay. These guys need to really step it up.
author: Angelo S.

description: 30 minute wait for a lame Mexican Salad.  Didn't offer chips.  Super confused staff.  Hard seats.
author: Anon A.

description:
I have not ordered much other than Tacos, beans and ceviche. I really enjoy the food but my goodness none of these people can get the orders correct. I never leave without checking my order and I can tell you that eight out of the ten times I have been there order was incorrect. Also, this is not the place for take out! You get far larger portions if you dine in. Today we decided that we will return but only when we have the time to dine in!

In short, check your take out orders thoroughly and if you have the time, eat in and take the left overs with you.
author: Chocoolate I.

description: Great place if you don't live in the mission and more specifically if you DO  live in SOMA. It isn't the est Mexican in town but it is in this area..and it's so inexpensive! I paid 8 dollars for the quesadilla meal- which is hands down the best thing on the menu! . Plus, all you can eat chips and salsa and a block away from where I sleep... im in.
author: Luigi A.

description:
Good: Cheap prices, nice location/decor, outdoor patio
Bad: The food - the food - the food!

I was excited for a new mexican restaurant and this place had promising hopes.  Location was great and it looked really nice.  The menu prices were like woahh such a steal for this area.  It was like mission prices but not so mission taste.  The food was very bland and just wasn't flavorful.  The meats were mushy and don't even think about their brunch special here.  Haven't done their happy hour here, but maybe if you get drunk enough the food will taste better

:::Breakdown:::
Place- 4 Stars
Service - 3 Stars (You order from the bar)
Food - 1 Star
Overall - 2 Stars
author: Manohak S.

description:
This place is good if you're hungover or drunk.
It's OK but I've had better burritos.
author: Amy L.

description:
Wow, I'm surprised the overall star rating for this place is so low!  I'm a big fan of this place.  It is true, that there are things that could be changed for the better, but i think that's the case with all new restaurants.  I came here the week after they opened.  Met some girlfriends here for dinner and drinks, and came again for lunch the following day with my company for my boss's birthday.  Instead of doing pros and cons, although the cons should definitely be taken as "constructive" criticism since they can easily be changed.

Pros:
1) Tortilla Soup - absolutely delicious.  Ate for dinner, and lunch the next day.  The chicken in the soup i had for lunch was WAY too big, and slightly dry.  But everything else was yummy.
2) Atmosphere - great space, great location, outdoor seating
3) Salsa - Yummers
4) The owners are very polite and accommodating.  They brought our food to us, brought flatware and napkins (even though we realized later we were supposed to get it ourselves)
5) Good red and white wine selections
6) Great prices - great happy hour speicals

Constructive Criticism:
1) Staff behind the counter needs to be a little more polite.  They must be new to food service, because they don't seem to understand the phrase, "the customer is always right"
2) Staff behind the cash register needs to be a little more assertive and move the line along.  I waited at the counter while the cashier pushed chips around and got salsa... the line was piling up behind me, so i said, "can i pay?" and he said, "oh, yay..."
3) No margaritas - Was a little disappointed they weren't serving margaritas, but the red wine selection was pretty good.  
4) Tacos are a little dry - perhaps they should add a "wetter" salsa (salsa verde?) to their selection - and not over steam their rice...
5) Tacos should not automatically come with sour cream
author: Lacey H.

description:
Good food here.  Not super authentic, but nice atmosphere and nice people.  It's right next to work, so I might like it more for it's convenience than food/pricing.  The prices are a little high, but you get chips while you're waiting, so that makes up for it haha.  

Takes about 5 mins for your food to be ready, so if you're in a hurry, not sure if it's best.  You can order online, which I have never done...so if you do that, write a review so I know what to expect ;)
author: Alison H.

description:
The food is just "okay," which makes the price a bit high. My main issue with Iron Cactus is the service is so slow.

During lunch, it takes them 10+ minutes to prepare a burrito order to-go. If you want a fast lunch, Subway is across the street and cheaper.
author: Chad S.

description:
If good intentions could make food get prepared correctly and taste good, I'd be a happy Iron Cactus customer.  Alas, that's just not the way the world works.  

As others have mentioned, they opened fairly recently, so I'm willing to give it another shot in a few months.  Here are the issues we encountered though:

1) The guy taking the order didn't seem to know the menu. I said, 1 veggie taco plate has 2 tacos right? He said, okay 2 veggie tacos. I said, no just 1 veggie taco plate. He said, okay 1 veggie taco. I said, no I want the plate, with 2 tacos. He did not say anything and wrote down veggie taco plate with a 2 next to it.  Hmm, okay, we'll figure that out later.  

2) The guy who takes the order writes it down in English, but the woman filling the order doesn't know English. He then translates it to Spanish for her. Sorry, but that kinda ruins the assembly-line concept. 

3) At the register, I clarify the taco situation. There's a guacamole situation too, but this is getting long-winded.  We go outside and wait for food.

4) The food takes awhile. 1 fish taco plate comes with 2 naked fish tacos and beans and rice on the side. The other fish taco plate comes with 2 fish tacos with guacamole & sour cream on top, and no beans and rice on the side. Burrito bowl comes with no carnitas on top as ordered.

5) Nice man comes and puts carnitas on top of bowl and comes out with another fish taco plate. This time it has sour cream & beans & rice.  

So, in summary, what you order may not be what you get, and it probably won't taste very good, but it will be served with a smile!
author: l c.

description:
Now that I'm living in San Francisco, I've got lots of foodie exploring to do, both around my new office and my new home. I was craving a burrito so I used my Yelp iPhone app to find a place close to my office. And that's how I arrived at The Iron Cactus.

There is a large menu and it's a quick ordering process, so if you don't know what you want, I would recommend stepping back to review the menu first. Since I was craving a burrito I went for the Super Burrito, which comes with sour cream and guacamole. I had 3 types of chicken, 4 types of beans and 3 types of salsa to choose from, so be prepared to make some very important decisions.

While it was a big, tasty burrito it had two negatives. One, it unwrapped so I couldn't eat it like a burrito, but had to use a fork and knife. Two, it was overpriced. I think $9 is a little too much for some basic ingredients. That said, I may venture back to try some of the combo plates or tacos, but I did pass a few other Mexican spots on my way back to the office that I may try out first.
author: Angela D.

description:
I had walked by this place several times and it was always busy so went in today and got a great Mexican salad with grilled chicken. Huge portion, lots of chicken, and the roasted corn was delicious. 
I was surprised by the mixed reviews on here. All of the food looked great and my friend loved the burrito that he got. 
Great space, friendly service, and the price was good for the neighborhood. I think I am going to become a regular...
author: Dave O.

description:
Nice space but the food and service need a lot of work.

Crispy Taco - not even kinda crispy.
Burrito - not terrible but the undercooked green peppers and onions were off putting.

FOH staff needs more training
Food needs help
author: Anton E.

description: I literally work right across Iron Cactus, in fact i can just see them through my window. So i've been here a bunch of times. I usually come here around 1:00 pm so i kind of expect it to be slow because this place is always packed. I mostly order their mexican chicken salad and it is quite good. It is kinda pricey but hey my tummy was always satisfied. Definetely coming back!
author: Vincent G.

description: I had lunch at the Iron Cactus on a Sunday.  Ordered two soft tacos and some gaucamole.  The chips that came with my were a little bit greasy, but quite.  Both the tacos and the gaucamole were good.  No problems with the service, but it was quite empty.  Seemed fine, but not a place I would go out of my way to eat at.
author: Richard M.

description: After a week since, I last ate my Super Steak Burrito at Taquería Guadalajara... I came here with my cousin on a sunday to The Iron Cactus just to get a Super Steak Burrito to go and take it inside to the SF Giants game... After eating it inside AT&T Park and before the San Francisco Giants take the field against the Boston Red Sox after when I was done with my Super Steak Burrito I have to say its okay but I like more when I go to Mission District area and buy a Super Steak Burrito over there...
author: William B.

description: Enjoyed friday lunch here with my colleagues.  Ordered the taco special and the portions were healthy and delicious, with sour cream, guacamole, lettuce, tomatoes all on your plate to add to your taco along with rice and beans.  All in all, the meal did not have anything special, was as expected and tasty enough...the best part was the pitcher of margarita that we ordered.  Swig.
author: Sherman L.

description:
Love the space... 

The food.. Not so much.

I ordered a regular carne asada burrito to-go. Simple enough. Can't go wrong with that, right? I was the only person in line and it took about 10 minutes to make. The tortilla was warm but the contents were cold. Their rice had corn, peas and carrots, which is something I'm not used to, but it didn't really bother me. It wasn't rolled evenly but the size was decent. It came with complimentary chips and pico de gallo (which were actually good). 

It's not bad, but it's far from being the best taqueria in the city. They recently opened so maybe I'll come back in a few months and hopefully I'll be able to update my review.
author: Zell C.

description:
This sucks because I really like the food; I go about once a week. And I was able to get over the sneeze guard without a top, and how they get my order wrong every other time, but the other day the food prep person who handled the money when I paid didn't change her gloves before making someone a salad... just dove her hand right into the lettuce. Money is dirty; I feel bad for whoever got that salad.
I may not be able to go back.
author: Cory C.

description:
Food was pretty good!  The seats are super long benches, so it's hard to get into your seat.  I had to do a flying double front kick in order to get into my spot.  It had to be super ninja style since I didn't want to launch the people already sitting off of the bench.

Unfortunately I had to get up and get more water.  I tried to hold out as long as possible, but the thirst really got to me.  I had to get out.  I lifted myself up with my arms and did a pommel horse like move to maneuver myself around.  Well ok, I don't know how to do pommel horse stuff, but this is how I imagine them doing it.  So if you're a gymnast, I think you'll have no problems with the benches.

Anyway, the portions are really small, so if you're really hungry I'd suggest buying two burritos!  If you get more than two, please post pictures of the aftermath, I'd love to see.  On second thought, with all the gymnastics and martial arts needed to sit and get up, you better get two in order to load up on the carbs for the energy needed.

Oh and I'm not subtracting 2 stars from 5 because of the benches, it's mostly the portions (which mean a lot to me!) that brought it down.  The benches are kind of fun.
author: Art C.

description: Really good burrito and the green sauce is pretty good. There will always be a line at lunch, but it's worth the wait. I really liked the atmosphere too. I can't wait to try something else there!
author: Nicole H.

description:
I ordered a typical carne asada burrito for comparison's sake: pinto beans, spicy, everything on/in it.

Seven-plus dollars later, I received a steamed tortilla filled mainly with rice, a smathering of pinto beans, a dash of salsa and a sprinkling of meat. Allegedly, there was also crema in there, but I found no evidence of it. I doubt if I've ever paid so much for a burrito that lacked cheese and guacamole. The flavors were one note, unfortunately that note was salty. I tasted, I added salsa and yet still I just tasted bland, salty flavors. 

Overall a pretty unmemorable first time experience leaving Chavo's as this neighborhoods best burrito (which isn't exactly a compliment).
author: Kenny S.

description:
I ordered a burrito just so that I could compare burritos to burritos, but Iron Cactus really needs to start working harder and pumping more "iron." The atmosphere was nice and the servers there were nice too, but the food was just not up to par. 
I was shocked that my chips did not automatically come with salsa. So I asked one of the guys at the counter and he gave me a small container of salsa that didn't look very fresh. 
Anyway, I had to drench my burrito in the not so fresh salsa because the burrito was a little dry and low in flavor. 
Hopefully Iron C will make more improvements in the near future.

On a positive note, I did get some free gas =P
author: Alex A.

description:
I have to say I am astonished by the number of low ratings on this place.  As someone who is hyper-critical of Mexican food, the Iron Cactus ranks pretty high, and it is the ONLY place to get a good burrito in the neighborhood, period.  I've been going to Chavos since the mid-90's and will never step foot in the place again, now that Iron Cactus has opened. That's 2-3 meals a week, if not more!


- FLAVOR: I do agree with a number of reviews that the food could be a bit more flavorful or spicy, but give them more than the two months they've been open and the flavors will grow better.  If you think restaurants are all perfect they day they open, then you've been living in TV-land. 

- PRICE: Compared to taquerias like Pancho Villa, the prices are high.  When you throw in the fact that the vegetables are all organic, it only makes sense that the prices are higher.  Still, paying 9+ dollars for a burrito is painful.  

- SERVICE: Amazing.  The employees are always smiling and saying hello.  After two times there they remembered me.  That makes a huge difference.  I noticed some posts about how confusing the layout of the place is, but it seemed pretty simple to me.  Also, the place has been open for all of two months, so the owners are there, and sometimes take an order or two.  The employees, including the cooks (and "chef") are virtually all from latin america, in case this makes a difference, and I think it does, on some level of perceived "authenticity".
author: Matthew W.

description:
Sigh. To go order. Really wanted to like this place as it's down the street from my apartment but it's just not good.

- The burrito is cold. There's no way around this. The tortilla stays cold and somewhat wet (wrapped in two layers of foil) while eating

- The carnitas has no flavor at all. Could at least mix a chili or something in when cooking

- The chips in the bag are decent, but no salsa thrown in and no visible salsa bar

- A little on the small side, so that the (cold and taste-free) meat doesn't mix with the other ingredients in the burrito. There is a high meat:other things ratio

- Maybe hire someone who's worked at Chipotle or Taco Bell to avoid having conversations like this with your customers: "I'd like cheese and sour cream"  "Cheese is extra"  "OK"  "So you want extra cheese?"  "Uhh, I want cheese on the burrito"  "It's extra"  "Yes, I get that. I want cheese"

Because of the location and the $8.27 you charge for a small burrito with cheese, your restaurant might do well, but don't delude yourself into thinking that you're doing a good job with the food because of it.
author: A K.

description:
Listen everybody, you are too harsh, this is a new place and is working out the kinks.   The quality of the food is great and this place has potential.

Notes for the very nice owners.  (READ CAREFULLY)

1. Your order execution sucks.   You need to place and order and pick it up or walk the assembly line and pay when complete.  you cannot do both.  Do yourselves a favor and take your staff  to poncho villa or even chipotle for an hour.  Watch and learn.

2. You need a salsa bar, the salsas are decent, but people want salsa for their chips, the .50 charge is silly.  

3. The chicken and carnitas are both awesome, but your execution on the tacos needs work.  1 tortilla is soggy by the time i get back to work.  They are cheap, throw 2 in there.  Also consider a different to go container, trying to pluck to taco out of there is impossible in the single size order.

Thats' all for now, love the flavor here, good quality meats, very tasty.  we'll be back in another couple weeks to see how you are doing.

Best of luck, giving you 4 stars to keep business rolling in, the bad reviews almost kept me out and I think you are just having growing pains.

you have potential.
author: Rick R.

description: I would rather suggest go to victor burrito which is just 2 blocks away from this place. Far better quality.
author: Malhar T.

description: Awesome Burrito Bowls, definitely worth the price.  I was doing a job training neaer here, and after the first day I was hooked.  Had lunch  there every day.  Oh and very fast.  If only they servced hot tortilla chips, and gave you more chips
author: Tatiana T.

description: Food was eh, and bland. I'll stick to me El Farolito thank you very much. I got the tortilla soup, which was just tomato soup with some veggies and chicken thrown in. Bland. And a baby burrito, which was fairly big and that was bland too. And the guy taking our order didn't look like he wanted to be somewhere else.
author: miss k.

description:
Cool place, but misses the mark in a couple of important areas.

The food is pretty good. Quality stuff made fresh. As Mexican food goes, it's at least an A-. Though it is strange to be given a basket of chips with your order but no salsa. Actually, there is salsa, but it's in bottles and there are no apparent bowls to pour it into.

The other things are the prices being slightly too high for what you get. And also a fairly awful parking situation. But I suppose both are to be expected in this neighborhood.

For me, I guess the challenges outweigh the incentives.
author: Stephen R.

description:
What a disappointment. I live in the neighborhood so was happy to see a Mexican restaurant that seemed casual and fairly inexpensive. 
My test plate at nearly all mex restaurants is the Taco Salad. Not exciting I know, my husband tells me that all the time. 
This was just about the WORST taco salad I've ever had. The shell was drenched in oil...could have wrung it out. The carne asada was old & dry, and the kicker was there was NO lettuce on it. I took it back up and asked for lettuce. The server gave me a dirty look and asked Why!! I said, it's under the salad heading, I'd like some lettuce!
author: bread p.

description: Spent a very brief afternoon here with some friends. First off, I was with my blackout friend and she did not blackout, so I think it's safe to say that this is not the kind of place you go to blackout. As for the restaurant, I can tell you that they have a beer patio outside and its cold and in the shade. The prices are more than I would like. It was pretty empty here on a Sunday afternoon. We left to get my blackout friend into a more black out friendly environment. I only came because she has a super fine friend thats real easy on the eyes.
author: Arthur C.

description: The inside of Iron Cactus is very cool and has a nice open feel to it.  The food however was just mediocre.  I had the two taco crispy plate and the carne asada was very good but lacked nay real flavor as did the salsa that was included in the meal.  With so many great Mexican restaurants in San Francisco, it's a shame that the Iron Cactus didn't deliver as a great place in SOMA would have been a nice go to.
author: Blake B.

description: I like this place!  It's handy (less than a block from my office), the food is consistently good, service is fast and the patio on a sunny day is a pretty awesome change from sitting inside my freezing office.   I've been here many times but most recently last Thursday with a girlfriend from work.  I decided to try the white wine and it wasn't horrible.  I knew I was ordering chardonnay from a mexican place near the ballpark so I wasn't expecting much, but it was drinkable so that is a win to me!  I highly recommend the Mexican Grilled Chicken Salad (sans red onions).
author: Lauren W.

description:
You need an iron stomach to eat at The Iron Cactus!

First visit. Ordered a super Al Pastor (dry and tasteless) burrito. The super burrito came with super disappointment. Who puts pineapple in a burrito without listing the ingredient on the menu? This wasn't a piece of pineapple, it was more like half a pineapple. Properly cut and placed throughout the burrito.

Yelp has this place listed with one dollar sign indicating it is a inexpensive restaurant. $9.48 for a super bland burrito is not inexpensive. WTF.

I'll give The Iron Cactus another shot but my first impression is disappointing.
author: Peruvian E.

description: Ahh, the great Mexican restaurant conundrum of San Francisco.  Good food, fun place, good drinks -- you can have two of these only, and most likely just one.  This place beats out a few others with some good looking specials (I was here for lunch), but really mediocre overall.  The ball park location offered some promise, but the food was weak, and service was disorganized overall.  Salsas had flavor and heat, but I can't imagine why I'd come here again.
author: Trent W.

description:
This is ok. Their happy hour is a good deal - 4 tacos and a pint of Anchor Steam for $12. The space is large, clean, and pleasant. If I wasn't a foodie that might have been enough.

I think I know why everyone's so unhappy - Iron Cactus isn't really designed for San Franciscans. It's very much a suburban phenomenon: grand space, slick appeal, ok food in big servings at high prices with occasional deep discounts. 

Unlike Nopalito, which genuinely offers higher value and charges accordingly, Iron Cactus doesn't compare well to our numerous native (and MUCH cheaper) Taquieras because it's basically the same food in a nicer setting. 

They *do* have better meat - I saw several stickers for Nieman Ranch but (a) I don't know whether it was in my particular taco and (b) you don't notice that much of a difference when the meat is marinated, chopped, and left to sit for a while. I did notice less fat and gristle, but it wasn't enough to justify coming here outside happy hour. 

This is basically a place for suburban commuters to drink and watch sports.
author: Amy T.

description:
Went here with a friend for lunch... it was priced a little higher than I expect for Mexican food, but I suppose it is appropriate for the area.  The place was clean, food was decent.  Wouldn't rush to come back here, but then wouldn't mind to come back either, if others suggested.  

The happy hour looks interesting - might have to update this review after I get a chance to visit the happy hour!
author: Leo C.

description:
Living a block away I've been quite excited to see new places to eat within walking distance.  While the new decor is nice and we appreciated the outdoor seating, we were both disappointed with the food.  I'll need to see an upward trend on Yelp scores before I'm motivated to visit again.

The details:
- Soft fish taco immediately disintegrated upon liftoff, so I had to eat it with a fork
- Carne Asada enchiladas were too salty
- While the food itself was fresh, the taste was just mediocre.

The location is ideal (across the street from Caltrain) and there's definitely a need for good quality food in this area.  I hope this place can overcome what seems to be a rocky start.
author: Jeremy J.

description: Bland taste, overpriced, good chips.
author: Tizia B.

description:
Not a bad place. Went there for lunch today and got a spicy beef burrito. I'm not usually a fan of rice w/veggies in my burritos but this one wasn't too bad. Overall it was tasty but missing that nice grilled beef flavor. I did appreciate the heat which at the bottom of it was actually too spicy.

I'll be back.
author: Simon S.

description:
Congratulations on the nice write-up in SF Chron! I don't understand why this restaurant gets such low ratings when it is usually packed with people.
I find the food excellent and the place has a very friendly atmosphere. The owners are such nice folks!  Even the folks who bring the food to your table are friendly. Today our guy even thanked us for coming. You don't get this kind of service much in San Francisco. 
Their ingredients are of very high quality. What's not to love!
author: Marcia P.

description: Updating my review. After raving to my bf about this place he finally came with me. We got the fish tacos per usual and they tasted rotten. Seriously fishy. No bueno. This happened once before and I thought maybe it was just me / bad day. Twice in a row and way worse than the first time. I haven't been able to eat a fish taco in months.
author: S F.

description: Best super nachos ever! Great location !
author: Krystal L.

description:
Ordered take out - 1 carne asado taco and 1 fish taco

Carne asada was kind of peppery and not that flavorful.  Very little meat with too much rice and beans.  Meat was also a bit chewy.  Single tortilla fell apart

Fish taco - where's the fish?  really couldnt find but 3 tiny pieces.  Again too much rice and beans and tortilla fell apart

They did give me some chips with the take out which were like the thin chips you get a Chevys...hmm ok.  No real hot salsa, just your gringo kind with tomatoes.  No green chile salsa.  Not sure if they had Tapatio on the tables
author: May M.

description:
I wasn't impressed by the food at all, portion was kind of small too.
Interior is nice but too fancy for taqueria. 
I prefer Chavo's or Victor's (which owned by Mexican) in this area.

I passed by today around lunch time and there was a long line out to the street. I thought wow this place rocks. But I looked inside and there were only a few customers eating. Obviously their operation is not working smoothly.
author: Hide S.

description:
An "everything is relative" review. I live in the Mission and work in SOMA. I have eaten at nearly all 20+ taquerias in the Mission. If Iron Cactus was located there, I would probably not return for seconds. It is, however, located in SOMA, and I will probably become a regular.

The ingredients looked and tasted fresh. The environment was spacious and clean. The prices seemed right. The employees, well, they stumbled about like it was their second day on the job (which it was). 

I look forward to returning, checking out their patio, and trying other dishes.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
So if I don't have time to go all the way from the Cal Train station to the Mission and want a quick "fix" - I'd come back again.

Two of us each got a burrito to go:  Chicken for one, Carnitas for the other.  Dining companion said the chicken burrito was good.  The carnitas was good, but not outstanding.  Had a couple of really hard, overcooked pieces of meat in mine that I couldn't eat - but the flavor was good.

Each burrito comes with Meat, Rice, Beans, Sour Cream (can't remember if it came with cheese or not).  You can order yours spicy or mild, and they put the salsa on the side.  Since ours was to go, I asked if they had a salsa bar - and they don't.  There are two types of salsa on each table, so I was given a container to fill up the salsa.

As I read in some reviews, beware of the spicyness of the salsa.  I can handle "hot", but the green salsa on the table that I tasted was more like "fire".  So hot, that you almost couldn't enjoy it.  I know, I am a gringo - but I can handle spicy food - but this was way over the top.  The red sauce on the table I brought home was good.

I am also a "chip" guy, and the chips they sent home with us were great.  Lacking in salt, so I just added my own.  Convenient, close to Cal Train, and in an area that doesn't have much in the way of "take it to go" burrito places.  I'll go back, but will stay far away from the green over-the-top-spicy-make-me-sweat-a-little-salsa.
author: Jason I.

description:
It's not authentic, but tastes ok.

I ordered a carnitas taco.  While the meat was well seasoned and well carmelized, it was TOO carmelized.  It ended up a bit dry.  

The rice was good though, and the sour cream was awesome.  (Wonder what brand they use.)

Also got the guacamole.  It was only ok.  Edible, but I've had better.

In short, Victor's has better carnitas, Chavo's had more selection and Tres Agaves has a fancier setting.  If you simply want a change of pace, Iron Cactus will do the job.
author: Cherrie C.

description:
Best advice:

1. Sit outside on the patio
2. If you order your salsa "spicey", expect raw jalapenos diced into the mix. 

As to what is essentially a cafeteria style Mexican food location, this comes with a few perks, including: a few screens to watch games on, generally very little wait, and a nice secluded outdoor patio (maybe a bit small, but nice when it's not busy).  

Atmosphere is fine, food is OK, clientele is mixed; over an OK place, and one of the better options for mid-priced and mid-quality Mexican in the SOMA/South Beach/Mission Bay area.
author: H H.

description: I think this place is expensive for mexican food! I've gotten a burrito, no drink, here a couple of times and it's $11 or $12! And not THAT good. Apparently they have good deals like happy hour drinks and $1 taco night, but aside from that I try to avoid going there because of the prices. Food is ok, nothing outstanding. Service is ok, nothing outstanding. It's nice that they have an outdoor patio and TVs airing sports, but you're paying for the ambiance.
author: Allison M.

description:
I live by the Iron Cactus and finally tried it today, was happy I did :)

I had kind of low expectations from some of the reviews here and was pleasantly surprised with my chicken quesadilla served with piping rice/beans/salsa...for $7.   Easily enough to fill me up and then some.  Enough to share.  A nice step up from a chain like chipotle, for example.  

I give the food 3 stars and 1 star for atmosphere, friendly staff and happy hour specials!  If they could improve the food a tad  it could be a 5 star joint!  Until then it might be a spot for a quick lunch instead of happy hour or dinner out.  Hope it gets there!

Nap time :)
author: Mike J.

description: I'm very hungry, however, only one Super Burrito was totally full....that's really big....thanks.
author: Chifeng Q.

description:
Great Mexican food period! I go here everyday for lunch and get one of their many salads if you want something light instead of a burger or sandwich. I recommend the Cactus Combination Salad if you like shrimp, steak and chicken all in one go.Nothing like paying $8.00 for a $12.00 salad They don't spare the avocados either. If I am very hungry I go with the Burrito bowl which is only $6.00. Their Melon or Cantelop Frescas are fantastic on a sunny day.
~This is a popular spot as it is attached to the Creamery which is a very popular crepe house/cafe. Come early and leave satisfied!
~Our office at Dolby has started to use them for catered events!
author: Patrick F.

description: Randomly walked in late at night.  Don't be fooled by the nice decor and high ceilings, the food is legit.  It hasn't been fully "americanized" into something like a chipotle or baja fresh.   A bit pricey, but the food is fresh, the salsa is hot, and the flavors are strong.   It's not a grimey mission mexican place, and it's not some uppity joint either.  I feel like it strikes a good balance between clean, nice decor and down-to-earth mexican food.  big portions.  beer.  and two tvs with sports on.
author: Derek L.

description:
Today was my 3rd trip here. I normally get a carne asada super burrito but today I tried the BBQ Pork. The first trip here the food was OK, did have a bite that was nothing but fat but that's not the first time I've had a burrito and this has happened. My second trip the food was perfect. Today though will be the last trip here. After deciding to try something other than carne asada I get back to my office to find I was given the wrong beans in my burrito. After taking two bites in I chewed into a small piece of fat. I looked down into the burrito and confirmed there was fat there. I grabbed a fork and reached in to pull what I thought would be a small piece of fat. Instead I end up removing (in one chunk) a piece that was literally 3" x 3" of fat and unidentifiable pig parts. I tried not to get too grossed out as I realized I could see part of a vein or organ. I quietly hid it behind my plate and boldly pressed on as I'm starving. After a few more bites I realized I just couldn't do it. Not only was the BBQ Pork lacking in flavor I just couldn't keep playing a guessing game of what would I come across next. I dug through a few times with a fork trying to find actual meat but there didn't appear to be any.

Very sad and disappointed by this trip. It's one of the few places in walking distance but I'll never go here again. I'll get my burrito's from the roach coach from now on.
author: Jesse P.

description:
If three stars stand for solid, two stars means it's a hit and miss sorta place. I've been here a couple of times to get my fix of burritos or quesadilla's and each time I've been underwhelmed or simply appeased.

It's not a fancy place and the food is just okay, a bit overpriced for the assembly-line quality you recieved.  If there is a redeeming quality they've got a fair selection of drafts on tap from Sam Adams (a hard brew to find in the city) and Negra Modelo among others.

Unfortunately I haven't found much better in the neighborhood that compares price-wise. So for now... You'll do.
author: Aaron M.

description: I come here about once or twice a month. This is the closest and most legit Mexican food in the area. It's about 2 short blocks away from China Basin. There is another place down the block however it is pretty crappy. Ill write a review for that place when I have time. It is going to be full of lulz.  Anyways..the only thing I ever get is the Super burrito bowl. I phone in my order and by the time I get there (around 10 mins)..it is ready. Show my badge and I get a discount. HOLLA. The Burrito bowl comes with chips. They have some spicy sauce in a bottle by the counter. I grab that and give my burrito bowl a quick splash. I don't recommend eating the burrito bowl to often as it is pretty heavy/filling.
author: Christopher L.

description:
tried most of their stuff, and sangria.. i have no common for them
however i do enjoy their mexico spicy shrimp salad and it's the only thing i come here for.
author: Jenni C.

description:
Maybe I just like it because the owners are so friggen nice, or maybe because they hooked it up FAT when we ordered from the catering menu, or maybe just because the food is so darn tasty. 

I've been here a few times and have left super happy every time. Though I do love taco trucks and super authentic Mexican food, I also do enjoy a larger establishment every so often. The people making your food are so nice and accommodating; one lady added black beans to my salad free of charge AND exchanged the grilled chicken for chile verde. Love her for that. 

In any case, give this new joint a try and be sure to say hi to the Irish owners, they're great lads. 

P.S. I also probably like them because their guac didn't get me sick *cough* Tres Agaves*cough*.
author: Stacey S.

description:
Ahh the Iron Cactus...truly a gem among bad restaurants. Before walking in here, I didn't know it was possible to render Mexican food inedible, but was I schooled! My guess is they either stole the "People on Yelp Love Us" sticker from the french food truck down the street or Yelp is handing these out for free....

My recommendations...stay away from the tacos...probably the burritos too.  You're better off sticking with the water, then go anywhere else.
author: Deuce B.

description:
I was overjoyed with excitement at a new place to eat near my apartment. But, alas, it was not all I hoped it would be. Because the food was edible and I might go back when hungry in the future, it gets 3 stars.

Pros:
1) fresh crispy chips - best part of the meal
2) spicy salsa
3) tasty refried beans and rice
4) they gave us a basket of chips and salsa even though we didn't order it
5) Horchata and the reddish brown drink (don't know the name) were very tasty and not too sweet

Cons:
1) the person who took our order was barely paying attention and kept interrupting to giggle about something that was going on in the back
2) disorganized service. we weren't given a receipt and they didn't put our drink orders on our meal statement so when our food was brought out they didn't even know we'd ordered drinks.
3) Under-seasoned carnitas
4) Bland tofu (I know I was stupid to try - but I hoped the sauce would be good)
5) lettuce in my burrito event though it wasn't listed as a potential ingredient (so I didn't know to request that it be left out)
author: Corinne R.

description:
Hung out in the back patio here today reading a book. They basically get the two stars for nice outdoor seating and convenient location. I'd recommend it for relaxing.

To be fully honest, I only had a bite of my buddy's burrito which he claimed was pretty bland. He ordered it spicy - and it had literally no spice. The two kinds of salsa they offered were very boring as well.

You could tell by the clientele that they really aren't succeeding, or trying, to make exciting food. The crowd was all white and older - the kind you'd find talking about how they like Chipotle. (Sorry, I'm not very PC over here)

The prices are way too high for the low quality as well.

For those in the area looking for flavorful Mexican food, go to Chavo's (4th and Bryant) or Maya (2nd and Harrison). Both awesome places.
author: Anish S.

description:
We went here for dinner the other night.  Overall I was pretty happy.  This place is a good addition to the neighborhood.  SOMA was in need of a decent taqueria.  

I had the spicy chicken burrito.  I wouldn't put it in my top San Francisco burritos but it was a heck of a lot better than the other burritos I've had around SOMA.  The chicken wasn't very spicy but the salsa sure was.  The chips were light and tasty.  They also have a few beers on tap and good prices on pitchers.

This place has the potential to be great.  I hope the owners read some of the feedback and work on the food a bit.
author: Garrett D.

description:
I live and work near the Iron Cactus and the Creamery. Very glad they came to the neighborhood.  Wonderful food, great warm and inviting staff, nice fun and clean space.  The tacos are generous portions with a great spicy salsa and fresh meat. You can get your burritos with wheat tortillas and black beans and grilled chicken...love it!
Recently I needed a location to host a charity event and as a good neighbor, the Iron Cactus opened their doors.  We had a fabulous event and appreciate the Iron Cactus supporting a good cause to help clean up our Ocean. Thank you!
author: Akva A.

description:
I'm giving Iron Cactus 5 stars for their customer service! Good customer service is hard to find these days and I was pleasantly surprised to have been treated so well at the Iron Cactus. 

It was lunch rush hour and their credit card machine was down. They did their best and tried to save everyone time by just taking card numbers down. When I had a problem with the charge the next day, they fixed everything no questions asked. 

As for the food, it was ok. I ordered the burrito bowl, something I'm a big fan of. Theirs didn't turn out so well as they used finely shredded lettuce that just ended up being a soupy mess at the bottom. I will definitely be back to find out what their burritos are like. I think I just ordered the wrong thing. 

The management at this place still gets 5 big ones from me!!!!! Thank you!
author: D. D.

description:
I'm not usually one who forms judgement or write reviews until I have tried the restaurant a few times.  Iron Cactus opened up down the street from me so I was excited to have a Mexican restaurant within walking distance.  So I can safely say, my review is based on 6 or so visits.

This place is hit or miss - which can explain the large delta between all the reviews.  Every time i've eaten there, i've had a fish taco and a beef taco.  Some days, the food is delicious...others, awful, bland and cardboard like.  I always go the same time of day as well, so nothing but the date is the variable here.

So my point is, hope that you go in there on a day where the food is seasoned correct - because on those days, the food is pretty good!
author: Dianna D.

description: This is a one of the best burrito eateries in town and the owners are extremely friendly. Fantastico.
author: S. N.

description:
Got a carnitas burrito after my friday caltrain commute home

Reasonable price.
Good solid burrito
Ooober close to caltrain
Friendly staff

Works for me.

I didn't eat in, but the place seemed spacious and comfortable.
author: Paul Y.

description:
I really wish that this place was better.  It is decent.  

I give it 3 stars because
*The space is very nice
*The happy hour is a good deal
*The food is decent

It just bums me out because with a little bit of work, this place could be 5 stars.
author: Jason B.

description:
Wasn't it Chevy's who coined the phrase no "smashed beans and rice?"
Well the Mission Bay now has an amazing option for "Gringo-ized" Mexican fare. But really this food could fit in with the best of the Mission district. 

The interior is bare wood and the menu is written on a chalkboard. The menu expands beyond just burritos and tacos and hopes to appease all types of people (read: you can even get tofu). They have many beers on tap and even serve wine!

Had to go with the basics and tried the carnitas burrito. I was advised that it is sold as a wet burrito with my choice of three sauces. I opted for the green. Wife ordered the tortilla soup. 

The hearty and healthy soup arrived to the table first (rather lukewarm) with a side plate of additional garnish including: corn, tortilla strips, queso fresco and fresh tomatoes. It could of used more of a kick but that is just personal preference and the table had two delicious salsas to add. The burrito had the largest chunks of pork I've ever seen in a taqueria. The green sauce that bathed the entire burrito was soooo yummy.

I used to hit Subway at the Caltrain station prior to heading down the peninsula but now I have a new vice!!!
author: Green Devil W.

description: Here's the good, the average and the poor about Iron Cactus. The restaurant has good ambiance, average food and poor service. I usually head over when I need a neighborhood place. Tonight I ordered ahead online and ended up waiting 30 minutes for my order. Also, the staff was busy talking while myself and other people waited for our food to be finished. Probably will not go back.
author: Alex G.

description: I went their for the first time last night because it's near my loft in SOMA.  I ordered the Al Pastor Burrito with Rice and Guac and I ended up with a severe case of food poisoning.  About two hours after I finished the burrito, I started getting intense headaches and stomach aches.  I tried to sleep it off to no prevail.  With in an hour, I broke out in a sweat, followed by a bad case of diarrhea.  I ended up throwing up all night.  Today, I feel terribly week and dehydrated.  Needless to say, I am not rating this place very highly.  Avoid the Iron Cactus at all costs.  If you have to go there, stay away from the Al Pastor!
author: Oliver S.

description:
LOL $29 pitchers! RIP OFF! Bad Service! Over Priced.

I will say the food is okay though. But I have been there 4 times now and the service always sucks, and i will not fuckin pay $29 for a pitcher of Pacifico.

This place is a RIP OFF!!!!
author: Kenny V.

description: We've gotten burritos to go from here 3 times now.  They are pretty pricey but we feel the ingredients are fresh and worth it.  They did forget my guacamole last time (but didn't forget to charge me for it) but otherwise we enjoy their food.  I've never actually eaten there but the happy hour looks like a good deal.
author: Plaid B.

description:
Disappointed for the last time....

I've tried and tried to support the Iron Cactus as I'm from the neighborhood, but it continues to be a disappointment.  The carnitas is typically dry and the amount included in the burritos is minimally inconsistent.  Other items in the past have also been mediocre.

The food prep line is always disorganized and tonight, a Giants game night, showed that management has not stepped in to keep it efficient.  With all the taquerias in the city, you would think management could simply observe how to handle orders with a crowd!

And tonight I watched someone make my "to go" order and when I questioned the cashier that it was missing an item, the cashier insisted it had been included until I made him open the container to prove him wrong.

The other cashier offered me some money back, which I told him to keep, and simply complete the order correctly.

Oh how I wish Dos Pinas was on my walk home from work!
author: David B.

description:
My burrito was mediocre but my hubby's enchiladas were actually HEATED IN A MICROWAVE!!!! 

On top of that, the staff were milling around, not staying on top of orders, and after we waited 20 minutes for our food to be heated in a microwave, they just let our food sit on the counter instead of taking the extra step and actually giving it to us.

Never again will we go to Iron Cactus!  I'd rather go to Dos Pinas any day -Dos Pinas has amazing food and competent staff, even if there's a little wait.
author: christy p.

description: This place is just bad.  I've been there three times just to see if it gets better and it doesn't.  I won't be going back ever again.  It's one of the only places that makes me thirsty and feel gross two hours later.  It might be MSG or over salted, whatever it is, it's not good for anyone.  And the scatterbrained lady that works the cash register, who might be the owner, should stay behind the scenes.
author: Jason D.

description:
I keep hoping this neighborhood Mexican restaurant will stop disappointing, but it just doesn't.  I've been there 4 times, and every time it's extremely overpriced ($1.50 to add jalapenos to a $10 burrito is ridiculous!), and twice they've messed up my order.  How hard is it to get a whole wheat tortilla with pinto beans?  

It's overpriced, the service is bad, they mess up, and the only thing that kept me going back was the proximity to my house.  It's just not worth it though.  Too bad, because it has a lot of potential.
author: Dawn M.

description: Terrible. Pre made chain food. Just awful. And expensive. Don't bother.
author: andrew r.

description:
Worst Mexican in San Francisco. 

Con:  high prices, rude services, bad tasting food, they send you home with the wrong order


I'm a vegan and my husband ordered me a spinach tortilla burrito with tofu and they sent it home with chicken in it. I didn't find out until I took a bite out of it. 

Another time I asked for a spinach tortilla and they sent me home with flour. 

Another time I asked if they had fresh chips that were warm and they said no and pointed me to the stacks of bagged chips that had been sitting around for hours. They have an area where they warm chips under a light, but it looks as if the staff got lazy and pre-bagged chips which over time got cold and stale. 

The burritos are very expensive and need tablespoons full of salsa to have taste.
author: J S.

description: Just like my rating shows, I think this place is just A-OK. I guess that would be surprising to my friends that work around this area who all seem to love it, rave about it, and frequent it on their breaks. Every time I've come here for lunch, I thought the food was decent, prices average, and the service helpful. I don't have any major complaints, I'm just not a huge fan. I've tried much better mexican food in this area, so if I can avoid this place I will.
author: Sonya D.

description:
This is a nice space with really nice patio out back.  I was, like a lot of other reviewers, ready to dislike this place because it's owned by gringos. Bleeding heart white liberal right here! ha.

I've eaten here twice and if you doctor your food with the salsas on the table (the green is freakin delicious) it's really good food. Last time I was there I got one fish taco and asked for an order of chips (they're good, man), ready to pay for the chips. Well, I didn't get the chips, but I did get a plate with a really good heaping fish taco AND rice AND beans AND the good spicy salsa. So hm! They spared me the fat-adding unnecessary chips and gave me a hella complete meal. Pretty great for $4.50.  

Every person on the staff is really friendly and they're trying hard, people. The place has been full the 3 times I've gone at lunchtime (once the line was too long and I didn't want to wait) -- the negative reviews don't seem to be impacting the business.
author: Dana D.

description: Not a fan. I sometimes come here when waiting for the caltrain and starving. They are good in a jam but nothing special. The tacos come out drimping in water almost leaving for a very messy meal. A little pricey too in my opinion for being what it is. I haven't had one of their burrittos in a while so I will probably write more when I have had more, but until then, this place is really only good in a jam
author: Greg G.

description: Came here for a quick lunch and drink before the Giants game.  I had the margarita on the rocks with a wet steak burrito.  Boyfriend had a shrimp plate that came with rice and beans and of course tortillas. He had a beer to wash it all down... Not too bad for the price...It was just OK though..Margarita was nice and strong =)
author: Charlene D.

description:
I love it. You're not going to get super authentic mexican food here but its still delicious. They also have a good selection of beers on tap. 

M-F from 3-6PM is happy hour with $3 beers and $2 tacos. I work down the street and stop in almost every day to get 2 tacos to go. They are always big and tasty. 

My only complaint is the charges for extras - like sour cream, $1 for some chips (if i buy a burrito or 2 tacos, throwing a handful of chips in the bag isn't gonna kill you). Still, gotta do what they gotta do. 

I like the guac, but I've definitely had better. I can't tell if it comes prepackaged or not. It tastes/looks a lot like Calvo guac you buy in the supermarket - I like chunky guac. 

But no doubt, you will get a damn fine soft taco for $2 during happy hour. When the weather is better, I'll be hanging out in their "beer garden" and bringing some tacos into the ball park.
author: Jonathan P.

description:
It's about time for a Taqueria in Mission Bay. The venue is quite sizeable and the staff are very friendly. I also ran into the owners and they seem like good guys.
The rice and beans here are great. The prices seem right. 
My two pieces of constructive feedback that take priority for me were the chicken and the salsa on the tables.
The chicken seemed too oily, almost on the greasy side. I ordered the regular chicken that comes out of the serving area where they make the burritos.  With this extra amount of oil l I hope their price doesn't change based on OPEC's oil production. ;)
The green salsa on the table was beyond hot. It was "darn hot". 
So in closing, if those two things change then a star for each.
author: M E.

description: Great food. Hormone free meat, fresh produce, really cheap for this quality Mexican food.
author: Hank H.

description:
Go back. Try it again. This place improved it's food drastically from last week. My company tested their food initially and came back at them with updates and they improved tremendously. The hot sauce has that kick, the food is fresher, the ambiance is awesome, the servers are nice, and the owners are the coolest. 

I've tried the taco salad and the mini burrito with spicy chicken.
author: Katherine F.

description: This place is OK..and I like plain food so I was very surprised at how 'not good' the food was.  I got the taco salad and it was plain and dry.. I thought ok I got a salad at a Mexican food place let me give it another try.  So I ordered a baby-burrito this time of carnitas-yuck! I threw it away after I ate half of it(its not very big) it tasted smoky and carnitas shouldn't taste like pulled pork it should have a rich pork flavor.  The black beans were dry and not that great in taste.  The only thing I really liked about this place is the guacamole and salsa they have out! Which is almost unheard of-to have all you can eat guacamole.  I dont hate it here and if I HAD to eat here again I would not get pork or black beans.. so you can be your own judge.  I gave this place 2 stars and not 1 because the service was really GREAT and the decor was relaxing and clean.
author: E N.

description:
I'm going to put as much time in to this review, as I want you to put in to going there.  My fiance and I both hated our food and almost left without finishing our meal.  We ate mainly because we hate wasting.

-The End-
author: David B.

description:
I had reviewed this place before and I gave it a very sub-par rating.  But this was the final straw, I try to eat at a place a couple of times before giving it a review and each time I ate there the quality of the food deteriorates and the orders come out wrong.

1.  I ordered 2 tacos with grilled chicken in a crunchy shell.  
2.  They said that because i wanted sour cream and guac that it becomes a super taco.  Each super taco is $5.50.  There is no f**king size difference between a regular over priced taco @ $3.50 versus the extremely over priced taco @ $5.50!  The only difference is guac and sour cream.  WTF is wrong with you people?!?!  $5.50 for a damn TACO?!  
3.  I got my order and came back to the office to eat.  I opened the box and what do I see?  I regular sized taco, with COLD flavorless grilled chicken, a cold taco shell that was STALE and flavorless and no sour cream and guac.  Again, I ask the owners of this place, WTF is wrong with your f**king service?  Do you not read yelp reviews?  Do you not take pride in the quality of your service and food?  
4.  I took a bite and spit it out immediately.  I wanted to walk back to the restaurant and show off my failed order in front of everyone.  What good would that do?  I get my money back?  Big deal.

I hate this place.  Never going here again.

- A pissed off person who also hates the creamery (same owners).
author: Milan D.

description: I have been giving this place the benefit of the doubt.  It is not the best, but it is also not the worst mex food.  Given it is like 5 steps from my front door, I have been ok with it.  It is decent, a little pricey but given the other Mexican joints in the hood close at 3 pm, this is been a good option.  Until today....not knowing what to eat and being cooped up indoors all morning, decided to walk over and get a burrito for lunch, and get some work done while sitting outside. Well, not only did i end up paying over 8 bucks for a bean, cheese, rice burrito, but it came out wrong.  My burrito had CHICKEN!!!  I noticed 1/4 of the way through.  Now, for anyone who is a veggie (like me for my whole life) this was a traumatic experience.  I took it back and explained to the person my issue.  He chuckled at my anger, and then I saw when he went to kitchen, the ladies behind the counter were LAUGHING!  So, I spent 8 bucks, panicked about eating chicken, got upset and laughed at...I'm done with this place...
author: Sheetal P.

description: It was a sad day the first time we ate here. At the time we were living about a block away and the idea of a burrito joint open in the evenings excited me to say the least (lazy not wanting to go 10 min into the Mission, I know). But the food quality is flat out disappointing. It was like cafeteria quality, sitting in buffet warmers. The flavors were flat, the service was like a fast food joint and the whole experience just seems off. it's a nice place insight, could be a really cool hang out to get tacos and beers, but just missed the mark with the food.
author: Darin A.

description:
meh... is the way to say it. 

pros: 
 -outdoor patio is nice
 - it's attached to The Creamery
 - one of my enchiladas had pineapple in it (a total surprise, but... hooray!?)

cons: 
 - totally lackluster food
 - black beans taste like nothing, rice tastes like nothing
 - no real guac... it's the premade/premanufactured kind
 - "spicy" items were not spicy at all

overall the food was bland, service wasn't great at the counter (very rushed).
we headed over to The Creamery right after for dessert and coffee, and found the service and food MUCH better there. 

it was $14 for 3 lackluster enchiladas and a diet coke.
author: L K.

description:
I'm sad to see so many people give poor reviews to this place.  Maybe it's because they were just opened when most people reviewed them, but it seems that they've taken the critiques on yelp and improved their service...when we ate there, we had great service, friendly staff, and pretty good food.  You can't really beat their happy hour ($2 tacos, half off some appies, and cheap beer & wine), and the space is cool.  They could definitely use: 1. a liquor license (i was sad i couldn't have a marg); 2. table service rather than cafeteria style; and 3. better salsa.   

The food wasn't the best mexican food, but if you go in expecting decent street tacos, burritos and reasonable prices, you'll be happy. I'll definitely go back.
author: Niki G.

description:
unfortunately, I am going to have to stop coming here for lunch.

2 weeks ago my chicken salad had a puddle of water in the take out box.

last week, my flautas were cold and hard to eat. 

Today, my tostada was cold & the actual tostada was dripping oil. (that means the oil was not up to temp when it was fried).
author: Audrey T.

description:
Despite the negative reviews I decided to give Iron Cactus a chance.  I regret this decision.  

My hubs came with and we placed an order to go, waiting anxiously for our order, only to find out that they had mistakenly given our order to the patrons before us.  So instead of trying to correct this mistake and make us our order again, they instead informed us, 1) we gave your order to someone else, 2)  we can't make your order again because we closed the kitchen 3) but you are more then welcome to pick out whatever you may wish to eat from what we have in open bar area... i.e. we are more then welcome to have the "leftovers" and what they would have to be getting rid of anyways.  Nor did they offer us a refund of our money nor a gift certificate.  We instead requested to get our money back on go somewhere else, which was a decision that I don't believe the restaurant was too happy with.  In fact, they had the nerve to ask, "Do you want all of your money back?".  Umm...let me think about that one...
 
I really wanted to like this place because it was close to home.  The place looked nice, but I was so disappointed in how they handled the situation that I will never come back here again.  SAD! :(
author: Susie S.

description:
Love: $3.00 3pm-6pm ( 7-day a week) draft Happy Hour and a heated dog-friendy patio AND tofu as a 'meat' option. 

Like: being able to order at the counter and completely customize what I do and don't want on my nachos or burrito bowl.  Also like the food prices overall and nice staff.

Not So Much: The food lacks flavor ( you don't crave it next week) and seems overcooked, kinda soft. Chipolte is going to charge you more for beers, but give a more flavorful experience you want to go back to.
author: Macy M.

description: Its really a shame that the service is so ridiculously bad, because the food is fantastic and authentic.  We really enjoy heading here before a giants game for a burrito and a couple of beers.  They have a great outdoor patio with a TV too, which provides a great spot to enjoy the weather and a ball game.  So great food, great atmosphere, bad service, chintzy chips and salsa baskets.
author: Nick V.

description:
I've not been here for dinner, so this is a review of lunch. 

The good:
*When it's nice out, you can sit out back on a patio
*Inside there's plenty of seating
*They have happy hour specials (although I've never tried them)
*Walk up to counter, order and pay is nice when you don't want to have to deal with table service on a lunch hour

The meh:
*Food. Have been here a few times, and the food ranges from average/forgettable to "wish I would have gone somewhere else". The prawns in the prawn taco tasted rubbery, like they'd been microwaved.

The bad:
*The people working there act like you are bothering them when you want to order and/or pay. Mostly, they are either talking to each other or are on their phones talking or texting. Could explain why my order isn't always correct.
author: t t.

description: The food and decor are A-OK, but  their lack of organization and consistency on more than one occasion has lead to 20 minute waits for a f***ing burrito. And on top of that on at least one of those occasions they got the burrito absolutely wrong, the lady ordered no beans por favor. I used to hop between this place and Mexico Au Parc, but now I'm sticking to Au Parc.
author: Michael A.

description: Don't get the super burritos as there's nothing super about them, just extra cheese and sour cream added to a normal sized burrito. I also had the super nachos and the serving size actually lived up to the name but the taste was nothing special; beans, meat, cheese, sour cream, and guacamole piled on tortilla chips. Maybe my review will go up after I come back and try the happy hour from 6p-9p for 1 dollar tacos and 2 dollar beers.
author: Angelo T.

description: I've tried to like it. Been there 5 times, enjoyed my meal once. I'm fairly certain it all comes out of a big can. I avoid it.
author: Douglas i.

description:
Food=7/10
service=5/10

The food is pretty good, but there are better taquerias within a few blocks.  However, this place is convenient to the Caltrain and open for dinner.  

They seem to still be ironing out their service there, but it has improved slightly over the last few weeks
author: Alex M.

description: Glad to have found a burrito joint near work for lunch! Had the burrito bowl, which is basically a salad, spicy which had fresh chopped jalepenos, yum. Love the free chips, yea.
